thread.title: Alien life: Nasa launch probe to search for alien life on molten surface of the SUN | Daily Star
thread.title_full: Alien life: Nasa launch probe to search for alien life on molten surface of the SUN | Daily Star

author: Jamie Micklethwaite
title: Alien life: Nasa launch probe to search for alien life on molten surface of the SUN | Daily Star
text:
JOHN HOPKINS UNIVERSITY APPLIED PHYSICS LABORATORY FEELING HOT: NASA will launch a spacecraft to the sun for the first time “We can't get to the very surface of the sun, but the mission will get close enough to answer important questions” Eric Christian 
Great strides have been made in the search for extraterrestrial life, with a new solar system similar to Earth sparking hope for extraterrestrial contact . 
But aliens may also be on our doorstep, and live in a much hotter climate. 
Space boffins are planning to launch the Solar Probe Plus, which will travel most of the 93 million miles to the sun. 13 signs of alien life Tuesday, 15th November 2016 Daily Star Pictures brings you 13 mind-blowing signs that aliens exist. 1 / 13 Shutterstock / Leo Blanchette More than 40,000 Americans have taken out insurance against being abducted by aliens. 
NASA research scientist Eric Christian said: "This is going to be our first mission to fly to the sun. 
"We can't get to the very surface of the sun, but the mission will get close enough to answer important questions." 
As well as the search for aliens , NASA are hoping to get to grips with the speed of solar wind and high energy particle beams emitted from our star in the 2018 mission. 
Experts want to analyse how solar wind gets its speed, and why the sun fires particle beams, which are a danger to astronauts and spacecraft. 
Mr Christian added: "The sun blows a stream of charged particles in all directions at a million miles an hour. 
"But we don't understand how that gets accelerated." 
GETTY ALIEN HOME? Experts hope Trappist-1 could harbour intelligent life 
Due to the surface of the blazing inferno, no spaceship can safely land on the surface, but the Solar Plus will get within 4 million miles of the Sun. 
To deal with the searing heat even at that distance, the spaceship will have to be fitted with a 4.5 inch thick carbon shield and a number of other safety measures. 
The spacecraft will be unmanned, but NASA hope to develop a spacecraft capable of transporting a human to the same distance. Related articles
